alert.note: Alert for Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 6:09PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kimball and southeastern Laramie Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 509 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 6 miles east of Hereford to near Panorama Point to 12 miles northeast of Pawnee Buttes. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Oliver Campground, Panorama Point, Oliver Reservoir and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 397 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 17. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
